statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 5 \\ -3 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 1 \\ -6 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -1 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ 3 \\ 9 \\ -5 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -10 \\ 7 \\ 1 \\ 7 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 5 \\ -3 \\ -3 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ 1 \\ -6 \\ 1 \\ 4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -1 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -8 \\ 3 \\ 9 \\ -5 \\ -10 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -10 \\ 7 \\ 1 \\ 7 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
